response: narrative=Scott Parkin was reported missing from his home at 23a Rosebery Avenue, South Queensferry. His mother last saw him playing near their vehicle parked outside. Suspecting he may have wandered off into a nearby forested area, the family grew increasingly worried, as he had recently been curious about exploring the sewers around 111 Glasgow Road, Edinburgh. Police, who traced him to 3 Murieston Lane, Edinburgh, pieced together that he followed sewer routes until he emerged near the location. Thankfully, he was unharmed upon being found.

narrative=Scott Parkin was last seen near a cafe by a colleague before vanishing unexpectedly. After days of extensive search operations, he was finally located by police in an underground sewer system far from his home at . Dunbar Road, East Linton, EH40 3DE, having wandered there unknowingly.

narrative=Scott Parkin was reported missing from his home at 23a Rosebery Avenue, South Queensferry. A recent discharge from a care facility seemed to have affected his mood, and a temporary arrangement was made for him to stay with his friend’s family at a remote cabin. Before leaving, Scott had lunch with his mother at a cafe on Strathalmond Road, Edinburgh. During a visit to the cabin, Scott wandered off, prompted by a discussion with his friend Tom Miller. His disappearance caused distress, leading to a city-wide search. Ultimately, Scott was traced by a member of the public at an address on Torphichen Street.

narrative=Scott Parkin, a young boy, vanished shortly after a court appearance related to an undisclosed family matter. His sudden disappearance led to an extensive search across various areas, notably around 1 St James Square, Edinburgh, and The Cross, EH49 7AH. Reports suggested that he might have been taken to the infamous drug house at 32 Glenorchy Road, a location known for its secluded nature and notorious activities. Friends and family, including his mother and colleague Toby Turner, were distraught, appealing for any information. Concern grew as it was believed Scott could be sheltered within a wooded area, making the search challenging. Four intense days later, the search bore fruit when he was safely traced by police at 22 Northumberland Street South West Lane in Edinburgh.

narrative=Scott Parkin was last seen at his home on Rosebery Avenue in South Queensferry. A friend of Scott's family mentioned he had talked about going on an adventure to escape worries at home. narrative=Scott Parkin was last seen near a local sports club parking lot, where he was observed by his colleague, Toby Turner, heading towards the nearby bridge. Witnesses later reported seeing Scott standing against the railings, appearing distressed and disoriented. He had recently been discharged from a care facility and had shown signs of confusion. Concerned for his safety, Toby attempted to contact him but received no response. Scott had accessed a vehicle that was reported missing earlier in the day. After a thorough search by authorities, Scott was located safely in Edinburgh. It remains unclear why Scott ventured to the bridge, but his prior discharge and erratic behavior suggest he may have been struggling with his recent release.

narrative=Scott Parkin was last seen near Strathalmond Road, Edinburgh, EH4 8HP, after leaving his home in South Queensferry. It was reported that he was traveling with a friend when they decided to explore the area beneath a bridge close to the location. Unbeknownst to anyone, the pair wandered into an unsecured sewer entrance that was partially obscured, leading to a complex network of underground passages. Scott's father, concerned after receiving no response from Scott, alerted local authorities. A detailed search involving both ground teams and drones was initiated, finally leading to a discovery of Scott and his friend inside an abandoned vehicle in the area. They were found unharmed, and Scott was safely returned to his family.
